workflow.name: Automate SEO blog creation from trends using Gemini AI, Apify, and Google Docs
workflow.description:
# Automate SEO Blog Creation with Apify + Google Docs + KIE AI‚Äôs Nano Banana API

## Who‚Äôs it for

For content creators, SEO specialists, and digital marketers who want to automatically generate SEO-optimized blog posts from trending topics ‚Äî no manual writing or formatting required.

## How it works / What it does

This workflow turns trending searches into fully structured blog posts using AI:
1. Fetch trending topics from India (or any country) using Apify‚Äôs Google Trends scraper.
2. Generate a SEO-optimized blog post with title, meta description, headings, and long-form content using Gemini AI.
3. Refine the System Message (optional) with Gemini AI for better readability and engagement.
4. Create a custom blog image using KIE AI‚Äôs Nano Banana API based on the blog title.
5. Automatically insert all content and images into a Google Doc, ready for publishing.

## How to set up
1. Add your Apify API token in the Google Trends node.
2. Configure Google Docs OAuth2 credentials for the document update node.
3. Add your KIE AI Nano Banana API token for image generation.
4. Schedule the Daily Trigger to your preferred time (default is 8 AM).

## Requirements
1. Apify API token (for trending search scraping)
2. Google account with Docs access
3. KIE AI Nano Banana API token

## How to customize the workflow
1. Change country or timeframe for trending searches.
2. Update the AI prompt for tone, length, or style of the blog.
3. Change the Google Doc ID to insert content into a different document.
4. Adjust image generation settings (size, style) in the KIE AI node.

options.systemMessage:
=You are an expert SEO content writer who writes high-performing blog articles for Google Search and social media. 
Your job is to generate a fully SEO-optimized blog post based on the user‚Äôs topic or keywords.

Requirements:
1. Create an engaging, keyword-rich **blog title** (under 70 characters).
2. Generate **long-form blog content** (600‚Äì1200 words) that is:
   - Fully SEO optimized with natural keyword placement.
   - Structured with **headings (H2, H3)**, short paragraphs, and lists where helpful.
   - Written in a human, engaging, and informative tone.
3. Include a **meta description (under 160 characters)** optimized for CTR.
4. Avoid repetition, AI-like phrases, or keyword stuffing.
5. Add **relevant subheadings** and **call-to-action** at the end.
6. Use current SEO best practices and trending search intent.

parameters.content:
## üöÄ Fetch Google Trends

Fetches India‚Äôs top trending searches in the last 24h via Apify API

## üìù Generate SEO Blog Content

Generates a fully SEO-optimized, human-like blog post from trending topics; includes title, meta description, and structured content.

## üìÑ Format Output for Google Docs

Converts AI-generated blog content and images into Google Docs requests with proper headings and formatting.

## üìù Update Google Doc

Sends formatted blog content and images to Google Docs using batchUpdate API.

## üñºÔ∏è Generate Blog Image

Creates a blog post image using KIE AI based on the blog title in 16:9 PNG format.

## ‚è≥ Check Image Generation Status

Polls KIE AI to see if the blog image task is complete before downloading.

## ‚úÖ Is Image Ready?

Checks if the generated blog image is complete; routes workflow based on readiness.

## ‚è±Ô∏è Wait 5 Seconds Before Recheck

Pauses workflow briefly before checking the blog image status again.

## üîó Prepare Image URL for Insert

Extracts the generated blog image URL to use in the Google Docs insertion step.

## ‚¨áÔ∏è Download Image

Downloads the generated blog image from the URL for insertion into Google Docs.

user.name: Parth Pansuriya
user.bio: I build smart and scalable automation workflows using n8n to simplify tasks, connect apps, and boost productivity. From WhatsApp bots to AI-powered systems, I create seamless automations tailored for business and creators.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
